stem: Following review of the patient's EHR, which action and rationale should the nurse prioritize?
options: actively listen to the patient's concerns
the patient is expressing feelings of anxiety and fear
the patient's pain level is currently rated as 7/10

blanks.correctOption: actively listen to the patient's concerns
the patient is expressing feelings of anxiety and fear

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
07:00 Patient reports feeling increasingly anxious about upcoming surgery. States, "I'm terrified something will go wrong." Appears restless and fidgety. Denies pain at this time. Vital signs stable. No acute distress observed. Patient has a history of anxiety. Explained the surgical procedure and potential risks per protocol. Encouraged patient to verbalize fears and concerns. Provided reassurance and emotional support. Notified the healthcare provider of the patient's increased anxiety. Awaiting further orders. Patient’s anxiety level is self-reported as 8/10. Offer to contact family support was declined. Patient is alert and oriented x3. 
07:15 Patient continues to express anxiety and fear related to the surgery. Attempted to redirect the patient with relaxation techniques with minimal effectiveness. Patient verbalizes, "I just can't shake this feeling of dread."

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content:
06:00: BP 130/80 mmHg, HR 88 bpm, RR 18, SpO2 98%, Temp 98.6°F
06:30: BP 132/82 mmHg, HR 92 bpm, RR 20, SpO2 98%, Temp 98.7°F
07:00: BP 135/85 mmHg, HR 96 bpm, RR 22, SpO2 97%, Temp 98.8°F

tabs.title: Lab Results
tabs.content:
CBC (Complete Blood Count): Within normal limits.
CMP (Comprehensive Metabolic Panel): Within normal limits.

tabs.title: Physical Exam
tabs.content:
General: Alert and oriented. Anxious appearance.
Cardiovascular: Regular heart rate and rhythm. No murmurs.
Respiratory: Clear breath sounds bilaterally.
Neurological: Grossly intact. No deficits noted.

tabs.title: Care Plan
tabs.content:
Monitor vital signs every 4 hours.
Provide emotional support and reassurance.
Administer pain medication as needed (PRN).
Notify healthcare provider of significant changes in patient condition.

tabs.title: MAR
tabs.content:
Scheduled Medications: None at this time.
PRN Medications: Pain medication ordered; not yet administered.

rationale.correct: Actively listening to the patient addresses their immediate anxiety and fear, fostering trust and promoting effective coping mechanisms. This is crucial for psychosocial well-being before surgery.
rationale.incorrect: While pain management and comfort are important, addressing the patient's anxiety and fear is a higher priority in this scenario as it directly impacts their psychological state and ability to cope with the upcoming surgery. Ignoring the psychosocial needs delays patient centered care.

answerBreakdown.label: Blank 1
answerBreakdown.content: Actively listening is a therapeutic communication technique that demonstrates empathy and understanding, helping to alleviate anxiety and build rapport. By prioritizing the patient's emotional needs, the nurse can create a more supportive environment.

answerBreakdown.label: Blank 2
answerBreakdown.content: The patient's expression of anxiety and fear indicates a significant emotional distress that needs immediate attention. Addressing these feelings can improve the patient's overall well-being and ability to cope with the surgical procedure.

clinicalPearls: Anxiety can significantly impact a patient's perception of pain and overall surgical experience. Addressing anxiety early can improve outcomes.
Therapeutic communication techniques are essential for building trust and rapport with patients, leading to better patient outcomes.

questionTrap.trap: Focusing solely on physical needs (like pain) without addressing emotional needs (like anxiety) can lead to ineffective patient care.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Prioritize emotional support and therapeutic communication when patients express anxiety or fear, even if physical needs are also present.
